intro: Ilex perado subsp. perado, commonly known as the Japanese holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, spiny leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature. Ilex perado subsp. perado prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings.
